text.p: Reuters America Inc and Netscape Communications Corp on Wednesday unveiled Reuters Web, a private, high-performance network based on Web technologies to deliver Reuters financial service products.

The companies said Reuters Web will incorporate Netscape's Internet client and server software and serve as a value-added feature of the Reuters 3000 Series, a new line of products for the equities, fixed-income and money markets.
"It will deliver high-performance, secure connectivity and information to some 340,000 Reuters financial services clients worldwide," the companies said in a statement.
The enabling technology at the core of Reuters Web includes Netscape SuiteSpot server software, which the companies said would provide distribution of database information and online applications.
The Netscape Navigator Internet browser will be packaged with Reuters 3000 Series this autumn, providing customers a desktop interface for accessing Reuters Web.

"Reuters is demonstrating its role as a leader in information services by taking advantage of the open standards and cross-platform characteristics of Netscape's Internet technology to deliver valuable information to its customers," Netscape Chief Executive James Barksdale said in a statement.

Michael Sanderson, chairman and chief executive of Reuters America Holdings Inc, said the launch of the 3000 Series comes "at a time in which we see dramatic developments within the financial services community."

"The thirst for information, analytics and connectivity has never been stronger...," he said, noting Internet technology made it possible for Reuters to meet these demands rapidly by making it a key feature of the product line.
Sanderson said the 3000 Series introduction was "Reuters's most aggressive and important information product development in more than a decade."

The 3000 Series integrates real-time prices and news with historical data and sophisticated analytics on a single screen, taking advantage of the company's new High Performance Shared Network (HPSN) and open systems standards.
This enables the products to be integrated into clients' own Intranets, or private networks that use Web technology, permitting more rapid deployment of new resources.

Customers can also use Reuters HPSN to send secure messages to one another via Reuters Mail, a proprietary electronic messaging service which the company said knits together a variety of functions on both the buy-side and sell-side of the financial services industries.
Reuters America Holdings Inc oversees the primary American business operations of Reuters Holdings Plc, the international news and information organization.
